Topic.Title: Oh well - just think of all the extra

Message.Msg: Those of us who have owned the stock for many years are used to this sort of gyration. I haven't paid any particular attention to your hundreds of posts over the last couple of weeks, nor will I, but from a random sampling you don't seem to be suggesting any practical alternatives. You are apparently someone with too much time on its hands that enjoys nattering and trying to get attention. Well, you have walked into a room of experts in that field! So, can I ask what exactly the purpose of your posts is? If you post to tell the very, very limited audience of ATT owners who are the uneducated, retired teabaggers incessantly posting their absurd political views on this board that they are idiots, you have my full support - but not because they own ATT. If you think you are trying to manipulate the stock price, you are even more profoundly stupid than the retired teabaggers on this board who happen to have a few shares of ATT. And to be more stupid than those folks, my friend, takes some serious doing. Realistically, if everyone who posts on this board sold, it would be about as noticeable as a mosquito's fart from a half mile away. Signed, LONG FOR THREE GENERATIONS.
RIght. You've got the bully pulpit on that one.
Poor people need to pay the same percentage of their incomes as rich people. What makes them special? They are probably working for a rich person, not a poor one.

The rich almost always pay LESS percentage than working poor. Warren Buffet pays LESS % than his secretary, etc. The reason they pay MORE in amount is they make MORE. Is amount and percent so hard for you to understand? The reason poor people are special is that they aren't living off the excess of their wealth, but need it all to live. They shouldn't have to pay more, in %, than the rich. It's called America where everyone has equal rights under law, one vote, and all men are created equal. Rich and poor we are all equal citizens. We help our poor from our personal excess. If you like aristocracy and peasantry there may be an island you can go to and start your own medieval style country..

Under the "Fair Tax" the rich will pay a higher percentage than the poor because the poor buy second hand merchandise which will not be taxed. Of course there will be cheating as there is under any tax system and some rich people will find ways to avoid the tax just as they do now. With a system that is less complex it should be easier to catch the cheaters.

doely_1: I don't think you understand "flat tax". Flat tax is assessed on income at the same rate for all. The cash register has nothing to do with it. It has nothing to do with how many jets you buy. The problem with the flat tax is that it still requires everyone to file an income tax return. The Fair Tax does away with the expense of the IRS and piggybacks the collection of tax on the sales tax system that most states already have.

Topic.Title: Oh well - just think of all the extra

Message.Msg: WOW!!! Three generations since 1983 when AT&T was founded. How did your family do that? You must be about 5 years old now. Are you married already? Be kind to ossobucco2012. This is the first time he has been right in a long time and his posts are always very short. Tolerance!!!

Topic.Title: Oh well - just think of all the extra

Message.Msg: It's not really as complex as all that. My father, my son and me. I'm no math whiz, but that seems an awful lot like 3 generations to me.
Interesting strategy.

Topic.Title: Oh well - just think of all the extra

Message.Msg: Thanks pal! Osso

Message.Title: Volume almost 3 X average
Message.Msg: In the first hour and a half nearly 17 million shares have been exchanged and that doesn't count the 8 million in pre market. Average volume is about 4 million per hour. The most amazing thing is that, with all this volume, the price has remained in a 35 cent range. It looks like as many people want in as want to get out.

Message.Title: Cnfirmed Bottom
Message.Msg: Possibly, only time will tell...

Just did. I STILL see it the same way, maybe you could be good enough to show the rest of us what you are looking at. What I see currently, is the possibility of a confirmed bottom, taking place right now.

"Every year ATT goes to PUC to increase my rates, because they do not have enough money to operate and expect me to pay more than $32 per month for a landline phone to sit there even if I do not receive or make calls and ATT has a monopoly on the phone lines." I pay $32 per month for my "landline" phone and I get unlimited calling 24/7. Please tell me about a cell service that offers that kind of service for that price and I'll dump my "landline." And who's fault is it that you do not receive or make calls on your "landline?" Is it also ATT's fault that you're an idiot as well? "Now, I hear that ATT has so much money they want to buy the Spanish phone company." I thought you said that ATT doesn't have enough money to operate. "Question: If ATT loses money operating the Spanish phone company, will they raise my rates to pay for those losses?" ATT has maintained or increased its dividend for the past 25+ years. They're no where close to losing money even if they do decide to invest in a "Spanish" phone company. Get off mommy's computer before you're caught.

Topic.Title: Oh well - just think of all the extra

Message.Msg: It is a great family tradition. Keep it up. I was just funning you. AT&T has been around in one form or another since 1875 when the telephone was invented. It was "Western Electric" at that time. Alex Bell made a crude talking machine when he was in high school in Scotland. Encouraged by his father to do so. The telephone was an accidental result of Bell's effort to transmit multiple messages over telegraph wires simultaneously. His understudy, Watson, probably had much more to do with it than he is given credit for but it was Bell's genius.

Switch to Verizon. I don't even have a phone. Just DSL an they charge me $52.49 per month. I use VOIP with Magic Jack for my phone and that costs about $4 per month on a five year prepaid contact. AT&T has to maintain the phone line whether you use it or not.

" It looks like as many people want in as want to get out." Not quite - another negative day. Probably very very negative by the close. $34 will be history today. $39 seems like a dream (sorry "Beau 39" !). Osso

...or possibly not! LOL Sinking as we speak. $34 will be history by the close. After July 7th or so (ex-div) this will be $31-$32. After earnings in late July $29 - $30. If the market can't handle removal of the Bernanke punch bowl as expected all bets are off and we'll see low to mid $20's again. GREAT FOR DRIPS - LOL!!!!! Osso
I'm with you buddy. One more bounce off from $34.10 and I think we will be on our way to $40; or at least $35.

I'm sure it will be zero (or even less) in under two weeks. ATT will be bankrupt and we will all be shouting at each other through tomato soup cans connected by string as we sit in our bombed out craters by our warming petroleum fires. If we all agree to stipulate to that, will you find something else to do with your time? Maybe you should cheer yourself up and rent "The Road".

Well you have been right so far. I am staying out right now because puts are too expensive and calls are too uncertain. All 110 of my call contracts are worthless right now and I have sold all my puts at nice profits.
$35 OR $40?? Don't go out on a limb or anything. Osso
Don't be stupid - can't go below zero. Osso
...and when market crashes another 1000 points you still see botttom at $33.70? Or when T misses revs again next month you still see bottom of $33.70? LOL Osso
Just checking to see if you are actually as delusional as you seem to be. Would you like to share with the board what you own that has gone up the last two days in any significant way whatsoever?
Don't need to go up last 2 days - just not lose $$ and you're way ahead. Osso
im signing up thanks man

Message.Title: Any change of a dividend increase?
Message.Msg: Since interest rates are set to increase, management should step up the dividend to convince holders that we should continue holding our stock. I'm considering putting the funds into another company with a higher dividend if this is just going to churn down into the 20s with a dividend that is near what interest rates will be in just a few short years.

Topic.Title: Any change of a dividend increase?

Message.Msg: It's unusual to find someone with a brain on this board. You are very wise to look to get out of this as a churn to the mid/high $20's is happening as we speak. The most they will ever raise this dividend is 1 penny per quarter (even though they can't even afford that). If they were to NOT raise it the 1 penny this stock would be in the teens over night. Never mind if they cut it - you don't even want to think about that!!! Osso

Topic.Title: Any change of a dividend increase?

Message.Msg: The dividend is usually raised at the beginning of the year.
Looks like we will have to wait until next week for the next bounce off of $34.10
Or Possibly, LOL!
37 million shares traded. 146% of average volume and all within a 63 cent price range.
I think we better pay more attention to osso. Markets are collapsing all around the World.
Or not! LOL! Osso
Are you mocking me? Osso

Message.Title: Very unusual volume activity
Message.Msg: 70% of todays volume were block trades. The average block trade 737k shares
.. part of the 300 mil. "T" buyback ??
wrong again.....
no...just early. I usually see these things before everyone else - much to my advantage I might add. Osso
Wow...you are as dumb as a rock. Osso
Would not be at all surprised. Good move for shareholder value.
Much better move if they waited a month for $29. Osso
Please, please, do sell. It will drop the price into my buying range. I have a large sum of cash laying idle waiting. It won't all go into T but a goodly prt of it.
Yes on gold & silver BUT, try to buy it @ market price (??) ... the seller's premium has quite a mark-up most places - same for real estate agents in their market !!
Buybacks are usually done over a period of time. I assume that they have financial analyst doing the timing.

Take a look back at the spike in short shares the first two weeks of May (10 million shares). The end of May report shows a lot had been covered, but there were still 74 million shares short, could have been some covering involved, at any rate it was a nice trade for someone. Short traders also know there will come a time when even in a time of rising interest rates, some stocks will be protected at the right percentage of yield. This one bumped along in 2009 and 2010 paying 6%, at around $25 per share. $30 per shares achieves 6% this time, so time will tell I suppose. Not saying it holds $30, just putting out the history of what has happened in the past.
